UI_visible_response: The Beijing LGBT Center closed due to "force majeure," which is described as a euphemism for state coercion. This was announced in May 2023 when the center ceased operations, citing "unpreventable circumstances"4. The closure is part of a broader government pressure campaign affecting LGBTQ advocacy groups in China2. Additionally, it has been noted that this event signifies a significant restriction on community spaces for queer individuals in the country3.
traffic_visible_response: The Beijing LGBT Center closed due to "force majeure," which is described as a euphemism for state coercion. This was announced in May 2023 when the center ceased operations, citing "unpreventable circumstances" [[4]]. The closure is part of a broader government pressure campaign affecting LGBTQ advocacy groups in China [[2]].
